{"id":518435549,"lang":"python3","time":"2 weeks, 1 day","timestamp":1625603866,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"64 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/518435549/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"14.3 MB","code":"# Definition for singly-linked list.\n# class ListNode:\n#     def __init__(self, val=0, next=None):\n#         self.val = val\n#         self.next = next\nclass Solution:\n    def addTwoNumbers(self, l1: ListNode, l2: ListNode) -> ListNode:\n        dummy = ListNode()\n        res = dummy\n        one = False\n        # whether there's an 1 adding to this digit\n        while l1 or l2:\n            curr = 0\n            if l1:\n                curr += l1.val\n                l1 = l1.next\n            if l2:\n                curr += l2.val\n                l2 = l2.next\n            if one:\n                curr += 1\n            # curr is the value supposed to be stored in this node\n            if curr > 9:\n                one = True\n                curr = curr % 10\n                res.next = ListNode(curr)\n                res = res.next\n            else:\n                one = False\n                res.next = ListNode(curr)\n                res = res.next\n        if one:\n            res.next = ListNode(1)\n            \n        return dummy.next\n            ","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers"}
